primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition of idolatry and unworthiness through a 'refining' judgment that results in healing and salvation.

tekstueel_bewijs: God will save us from the judgment
He will sit as a refiner and purifier

object.identificatie: Salvation, healing, and the removal of Sin/Death
tekstueel_bewijs: to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ
do away with Sin and Death forever

zender.identificatie: The Holy Scriptures / The Character of God (Holy/Righteous)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Scriptures... contain a great many passages about judgment
the high and lofty one who inhabits eternity

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearers / The Church / 'Children of Light'
tekstueel_bewijs: But you are not in darkness
We are all children of light! We, here in this space today!

helper.identificatie: The 'Great BUT' (Divine Grace), The Refiner's Fire, The Messenger
tekstueel_bewijs: the grace of God working through some remarkable people
he is like a refiner’s fire

tegenstander.identificatie: Idolatry, Sin, Death, and the 'perpetual factory of idols' (Human Heart)
tekstueel_bewijs: the rule of Sin and Death in the world
the human heart, which constantly misleads and deceives
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin and Death are treated as ontological powers that require a divine Judge to overthrow; they are not merely bad habits.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church waiting and encouraging one another in the 'night' before the second coming.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / Hearers
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'putting on the breastplate' is a response to the primary fact that God has destined them for salvation.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will save us from the judgment
He will sit as a refiner
God has not destined us for wrath
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We’ve devised all sorts of stratagems
we have left undone those things

voorbeelden: things that we ought to have done
I am looking forward to passing through the refiner’s fire
Everything depends on what we know of Jesus Christ
Only a very great and mighty Judge is able to do what is promised
he will purify the sons of Levi

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to effect change where humans are incompetent (no health in us).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the idol of 'Impunity' (~S2) to the reality of 'Judgment' (S2), then through the 'Great BUT' to 'Grace' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Judgment is not the opposite of Grace but the means of it (Refiner's fire).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; judgment is described as 'ferocious' and 'sudden destruction'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies human inability and positions God as the sole agent of salvation and transformation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I have recognized that there are certain impulses... I have worked very hard to overcome

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I will heal them; I will lead them
the rule of Sin and Death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Pharisees, Isaiah) are used to diagnose the human condition, not as models for imitation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who purifies the sons of Levi.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope in the face of personal failure.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'wrath' of judgment to the 'healing' of the 'BUT' is logically and theologically tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'working hard to overcome' and the 'refiner's fire' doing the work.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has promised us that he will do away with Sin and Death forever.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' directly to Christ/God.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an indwelling power that humans cannot 'scoot out from underneath'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: Strongly theocentric with God as the primary Subject. The narrative engine is driven by divine intervention (the 'BUT').

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more emphasis on the 'Vouloir' (the desire of the church) in the waiting period.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on what it looks like to 'encourage one another' as a response to the 'BUT'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the Gospel while taking the reality of judgment seriously.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'BUT' as a stylistic device, Greimas shows it is the actantial pivot that switches the story from Judgment to Salvation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of the Isaiah/Thessalonians texts to show how they function as a 'Mandate' from the Sender to the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Refiner's Fire' is a Helper to the Subject (God), not an Opponent to the Receiver (Man).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper-God' trap where God merely assists human effort.
